column5: got a tutorial from MM and now i can post images. too bad i never take a picture of fish i catch, but i do take alot of bbq porn!    and the occasional boat pic - this was how every morning started on lower buckhorn lst week.
There's some good lookin' food for you. Great looking morning shot too! Those chickens don't look too comfortable though eh?
they kinda look like a couple of hobos warming their hands by the fire - but i dont think that's what you meant by 'uncomfortable' is it?  it helps to buy them a drink before you put the cans in....

You just make me "Hungry"- to go -  just had to throw that in. My wife just said, why doesn't my ribs and chicken look like that. my excuse is to her is I cook blackened Cajun. Man, that food looks good.
Hahahaha, hobos by the fire! That picture looks hilarious now!  Lower Buckhorn is where I pulled that musky in my profile pic out of in august! That lake is RAMMED with smallies

its also RAMMED with weeds (not quite what im used to).  great musky, i had a lot of followups on smallies i was catching.  average smallie is on the small side, but ive had a few nice ones.  giant pumpkinseeds and crappy to keep us busy.
If those ribs and chicken taste half as good as the picture suggests I would be honored to sit at your table.   Art
well thanks fellas recently got the charcoal Weber and am lovin the thing.  i'll post some more if ya like.
Yup. Made me hungry too! Never targeted bass on buckhorn. It would be cool to see a musky nail one!
Looks Dee-li-cious!! Beer can chicken rocks!! Garlic salt, pepper and a bit of paprika for colour and that's it!! Gotta love cooking on charcoal, gas just doesn't give you the flavour.
